chunk.text: S1 Text-Details of the parametric dependence of the force of infection on specific humidity

Eq. 11 allows the transmission rate to depend on time using three terms. The first time dependent term, F 1 (t), allows for a dependence of the transmission rate on specific-humidity. In temperate regions specific humidity has a seasonal oscillation with a minimum in the winter and a maximum in the summer. We follow Shaman et al. [1] and relate the local SH, q j (t), to the reproduction number as:
